definition: Miscellaneous School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) whose leading advocate was Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The predecessor scholars have corrected some of the errors. Zi Radical and Miscellaneous Scholars catalogue have even more problems.
sentences.chinese: 前辈学者对之已多所纠正，子部杂家类的问题尤多。

definition: I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
xing-ming, a school of thought of the Warring States period associated with Shen Buhai 申不害[Shen1 Bu4 hai4]/the designation for a punishment
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
lord/master/young gentleman/male prostitute/catamite/mahjong player disqualified by unintentionally taking in the wrong number of dominoes/(old form of address for one's husband) husband
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
